t: Job 8
Bildad Says God Rewards the Good
Then*p Bildad the Shuhite answered,
“How*pn long will you say these things, And*ln the words of your mouth be a mighty wind?
Does*ln God pervert justice? Or*ln does the Almighty pervert what is right?
If*ln your sons sinned against Him, Then*ln He delivered them into the power of their transgression.
If*ln you would seek God And*ln implore the compassion of the Almighty,
If*ln you are pure and upright, Surely*ln now He would rouse Himself for you And*ln restore your righteous estate.
Though*ln your beginning was insignificant, Yet*ln your end will increase greatly.
“Please*ln inquire of past generations, And*ln consider the things searched out by their fathers.
For*ln we are only*i of yesterday and know nothing, Because*ln our days on earth are as a shadow.
Will*ln they not teach you and*i tell you, And*ln bring forth words from their minds?
“Can*ln the papyrus grow up without a marsh? Can*ln the rushes grow without water?
While*ln it is still green and*i not cut down, Yet*ln it withers before any other*i plant.
So*ln are the paths of all who forget God; And*ln the hope of the godless will perish,
Whose*ln confidence is fragile, And*ln whose trust a spider’s web.
He*ln trusts in his house, but it does not stand; He*ln holds fast to it, but it does not endure.
He*ln thrives before the sun, And*ln his shoots spread out over his garden.
His*ln roots wrap around a rock pile, He*ln grasps a house of stones.
If*ln he is removed from his place, Then*ln it will deny him, saying,*i ‘I never saw you.’
Behold,*ln this is the joy of His way; And*ln out of the dust others will spring.
Lo,*ln God will not reject a*i man*i of*i integrity, Nor*ln will He support the evildoers.
He*ln will yet fill your mouth with laughter And*ln your lips with shouting.
Those*ln who hate you will be clothed with shame, And*ln the tent of the wicked will be no longer.”
